item.title: 对冲基金称英国央行回购改革有可能损害英国国债的吸引力
item.description: 对冲基金正在反击英格兰银行旨在限制英国债券交易商风险承担的提议，认为这些政策将损害流动性和市场的全球吸引力。【原文：Hedge funds are pushing back against Bank of England proposals intended to limit risk taking among UK bond traders, arguing the policies would hurt liquidity and the market’s global attractiveness.】

item.title: 意大利第三季度经济仍略有增长
item.description: 在国内需求的支持下，意大利第三季度经济略有增长，而不是像原先预计的那样停滞不前。【原文：Italy managed to notch up some slight growth in the third quarter amid support from domestic demand, instead of just stagnating as originally estimated.】

item.title: 交易所故障影响期货市场，投资者盲目跟风
item.description:
数据中心故障导致芝加哥商业交易所期货和期权交易停止，引发了广泛的不满情绪。【原文：

A data center fault has halted trading of futures and options on the Chicago Mercantile Exchange, triggering widespread frustration.

】

item.title: 尽管美国加征关税，印度经济增长仍为六季以来最快
item.description: 尽管美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）征收的高额关税给经济前景蒙上了阴影，但印度经济仍以六个季度以来最快的速度增长，彰显了印度经济的韧性。【原文：India’s economy grew at the fastest pace in six quarters, underscoring its resilience even as US President Donald Trump’s steep tariffs cloud the outlook.】

item.title: 智利总统何塞-安东尼奥-卡斯特在总统选举民调中领先二十个百分点
item.description: 一项新的民意调查显示，智利极端保守派总统候选人何塞-安东尼奥-卡斯特（José Antonio Kast）在 12 月的决选前领先其左派竞选者约 20 个百分点，因为选民对他的看法有所改善。【原文：Chile’s ultra-conservative presidential candidate José Antonio Kast opened up a roughly twenty-point lead over his leftist contender ahead of the December runoff as voter perceptions of him improved, according to a new poll.】

item.title: 在贸易谈判中反击特朗普，卡尼需要一本新剧本
item.description: 马克-卡尼（Mark Carney）是以经济危机斗士的形象在加拿大上台的，他能够修复加拿大与美国破裂的关系。在他赢得全国大选七个月后，加拿大的经济仍处于脆弱状态，与特朗普政府的贸易休战也一直遥遥无期。【原文：Mark Carney came to power in Canada by pitching himself as an economic crisis fighter who could fix the country’s ruptured relationship with the US. Seven months after he won a national election, the economy is in a fragile state, and a trade truce with the Trump administration has been elusive.】

item.title: 美国交易所运营商成为焦点，故障导致期货交易冻结
item.description: 芝加哥商品交易所集团（CME Group Inc.）、纽约证券交易所所有者洲际交易所（Intercontental Exchange Inc.【原文：Shares in CME Group Inc., New York Stock Exchange-owner Intercontinental Exchange Inc. and Nasdaq Inc. are in focus in Friday’s premarket, after a technical glitch froze futures trading on the Chicago Mercantile Exchange.】

item.title: 捷克经济增长超出预期，推动利率保持谨慎
item.description: 捷克第三季度的经济增长速度超过预期，这为中央银行维持紧缩货币政策立场提供了更多理由。【原文：Czech economic growth accelerated more than expected in the third quarter, adding to reasons for the central bank to maintain a tight monetary policy stance.】

item.title: 波兰通胀率低于目标，为降息提供动力
item.description: 波兰 11 月份的通胀放缓幅度超过预期，低于央行 2.5% 的目标，这为央行连续第五次降息提供了有力的论据。【原文：Polish inflation slowed more than expected in November, coming below the central bank’s target of 2.5% and giving the central bank strong arguments to cut interest rates for a fifth straight meeting.】

item.title: <strong>这就是信用卡利率如此之高的原因</strong
item.description:
信贷用户为自己的营销买单。【原文：

Credit users are paying for their own marketing.

item.title: 奇货可居：这就是信用卡费率如此之高的原因（播客）
item.description: 奇货可居：这就是信用卡费率如此之高的原因（播客）【原文：Odd Lots: This Is Why Credit Card Rates Are so High (Podcast)】

item.title: 全球市场处于 "历史性关口"，铜市紧张局势加剧
item.description: 供需失衡、中国角色的转变以及美国总统唐纳德-特朗普贸易议程的不确定性引发了全球铜市场的大动荡。【原文：The global copper market is facing major upheaval, triggered by supply-demand imbalances, the shifting role of China and the uncertainty surrounding US President Donald Trump’s trade agenda.】

item.title: 印度卢比因进口商买入美元和贸易担忧而跌至创纪录水平
item.description: 受进口商对美元的需求以及为降低美国对南亚国家的苛刻关税而达成的贸易协议迟迟未能达成的影响，印度卢比走软，创下新纪录。【原文：India’s rupee weakened to a new record, pressured by dollar demand from importers and delays in reaching a trade deal that would reduce harsh US tariffs on the South Asian nation.】

item.title: 韩国银行因股票挂钩票据面临创纪录的 14 亿美元罚款风险
item.description: 据当地媒体报道，韩国金融监管部门已就不当销售股票挂钩证券问题向五家银行发出初步通知，可能导致约 14 亿美元的罚款。【原文：South Korea’s financial watchdog has sent a preliminary notice to five banks over improper sales of equity-linked securities, which local media reported could result in some $1.4 billion of penalties.】

item.title: 意大利在调整黄金权力规则时寻求保留银行否决权
item.description: 乔治亚-梅洛尼（Giorgia Meloni）政府正在探索如何在不失去银行业交易否决权的情况下改变其金融监管规则，以化解与欧盟的潜在冲突。【原文：Giorgia Meloni’s government is exploring ways to change its financial oversight rules without losing its banking deal veto power, as it seeks to defuse a potential clash with the European Union.】

item.title: 价格战带来损失，美团自 2022 年以来首度亏损
item.description: 美团公布了近三年来的首次亏损，反映了在疲软的中国消费市场上与阿里巴巴集团和 JD.com Inc.【原文：Meituan posted its first loss in almost three years, reflecting the toll of a three-way battle with Alibaba Group Holding Ltd. and JD.com Inc. in a weak Chinese consumer market.】

item.title: 欧洲人工智能佼佼者西门子能源价值接近 1000 亿欧元
item.description: 在人工智能泡沫引发的市场广泛担忧导致股价暴跌仅七天之后，欧洲最大的人工智能主题赢家又回到了创纪录的水平附近。【原文：Only seven days after a drubbing caused by broad market concerns of an artificial-intelligence bubble, Europe’s biggest winner from the theme is back near record levels.】

item.title: 激进投资者 AVI 将向日本中小型企业增资 380 亿日元
item.description: 总部位于伦敦的激进资产价值投资者有限公司（Asset Value Investors Ltd.）计划在两家投资信托公司合并后，再向日本中小型公司投资 380 亿日元（2.43 亿美元）。【原文：London-based activist Asset Value Investors Ltd. plans to invest an additional ¥38 billion ($243 million) in Japanese small- and mid-cap companies following the merger of two investment trusts.】

item.title: 工会称南非萨曼科尔铬业公司将裁员 2,500 人
item.description: 萨曼科铬业有限公司（Samancor Chrome Ltd.）的一个工会表示，由于能源成本高昂，该公司考虑关闭或缩减业务，明年可能会在南非裁员多达2496人。【原文：Samancor Chrome Ltd. may cut as many as 2,496 jobs in South Africa next year as it considers closing or slimming down operations because of high energy costs, a labor union said.】

item.title: 南非糖业游说团称创纪录的进口量使就业面临风险
item.description: 南非创纪录的食糖进口量威胁到当地多达 100 万名员工的种植者，促使该行业的游说团体要求消费者只购买本国生产的甜味剂。【原文：Record sugar imports by South Africa threaten local growers who employ as many as 1 million people, prompting the industry’s lobby to ask consumers to only buy home-grown sweeteners.】

item.title: 瑞士的出口困境在贸易协议达成前重创经济
item.description: 瑞士经济两年多来首次出现季度萎缩，主要原因是制药和化工出口商受到美国超额关税的影响，导致贸易萎缩。【原文：Switzerland’s first quarter of contraction in more than two years was driven by trade as pharmaceutical and chemicals exporters reeled from the impact of outsized US tariffs.】

item.title: 西班牙保持强劲势头，法国通胀意外保持稳定
item.description: 法国 11 月份的通胀出乎意料地保持不变，而西班牙的通胀放缓程度则低于分析师的预期，这凸显出该地区一些最大经济体的物价形势喜忧参半。【原文：French inflation unexpectedly remained unchanged in November, while Spain’s eased less than analysts had anticipated, highlighting the mixed picture for prices in some of the region’s biggest economies.】

item.title: 瑞典经济飙升，瑞典央行暂停利率计划面临风险
item.description: 瑞典的经济增长速度达到了两年多来的最快水平，这表明该国央行可能需要比其决策者发出的信号更早地提高利率。【原文：Sweden’s economic growth surged to its fastest pace in over two years, suggesting the nation’s central bank may need to raise interest rates sooner than its policymakers are signaling.】

item.title: 哈萨克斯坦将关键利率维持在创纪录水平以应对通胀
item.description: 在央行紧缩政策和政府措施导致通胀出现放缓迹象后，哈萨克斯坦将利率维持在历史最高水平，但警告称明年上半年不太可能降低借贷成本。【原文：Kazakhstan held interest rates at a record high after inflation showed signs of slowing due to central bank tightening and government measures, but warned it was unlikely to lower borrowing costs in the first half of next year.】

item.title: 斯蒂芬-詹说：英国经济面临过度征税风险，英镑将走软
item.description: 对冲基金经理斯蒂芬-詹（Stephen Jen）认为，随着英国接近临界点，增税不再能为政府带来额外收入，英镑可能会下滑。【原文：The pound is likely to slump as the UK approaches a tipping point where tax hikes no longer bring in extra money for the government, according to hedge fund manager Stephen Jen.】

item.title: 英镑下滑，股市持稳，期货交易受阻
日本将在额外预算中为人工智能和半导体斥资 20 亿美元
item.description: 日本将投入约 2525 亿日元（16 亿美元）的额外预算，进一步支持人工智能和半导体的发展。【原文：Japan is set to spend roughly ¥252.5 billion ($1.6 billion) in an extra budget to further support developments of artificial intelligence and semiconductors.】

item.title: 中国主权债券交易商警惕万科事件的影响
item.description: 中国万科债务危机的恶化提高了主权债券交易商对该房地产开发商困境蔓延的警惕。【原文：The worsening debt crisis at China Vanke Co. has increased vigilance among sovereign bond traders over contagion from the property developer’s woes.】

item.title: 日本致命的熊袭击事件促使保险公司推出新产品
item.description: 在日本，几乎没有一天不传出熊袭击人的消息，但这个令当地居民、游客和农民担忧并阻碍休闲相关业务发展的问题却为保险公司带来了机遇。【原文：Hardly a day goes by in Japan without news of another bear attack, but a problem that’s worrying local residents, tourists and farmers and hampering leisure-related businesses is presenting an opportunity for insurers.】

item.title: 日本将发行更多短期债券为高市刺激计划提供资金
item.description: 日本计划增发短期债务，为首相佐那江隆一的经济一揽子计划提供资金，此举正值市场对财政纪律和超长收益率的上升压力感到不安之际。【原文：Japan plans to increase its issuance of short-term debt to help finance Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi’s economic package, a move that comes as markets grow uneasy about fiscal discipline and upward pressure on super-long yields.】
